attributes.action: The Government should hold a new referendum on the UK leaving the EU
attributes.additional_details:
In January, polling showed that 87 percent would like to see the UK remain in the single market, and 78 percent want a referendum on the final deal. 
Nobody during the referendum campaign knew or explained what the Leave vote meant. 
The Leave campaign lied to the country on a scale never seen before in a modern UK poll, promises about Brexit were made which can never be met.
Claims, deceptive and disingenuous information were made about the EU that was and is demonstrably wrong – the Leave campaign acted dishonestly.
The Electoral Commission alleges a 'common plan' between different Leave campaigns broke rules
attributes.background:
By refusing to hold another referendum the government is not acting in the best interests of the people of the United Kingdom. 
The refusal to hold another referendum is un-democratic. 
The last referendum was purely party political and the refusal to hold another is the same
